page.title: 04MR. BERT BUTLER
page.content: {Mr Bert Butler - born Winchcombe 1906. Attended Winchcombe School when it was first opened in 1911. He left school at 13 and trained as an undergardener at Sudeley and was head gardener at three different English stately homes.Was a regular broadcaster of his experiences, for many years with the BBC and has had published "A Cotswold Rag Bag" which is a collection of some of his stories. (3) He recalls poor living conditions;wood fires for cooking/hot water,no running water in houses,earth floors in the kitchen, paraffin lamps and candles, (electricity came to{W}in '28) large families, they often slept five to a bed.Poor children did not have toys, they made their own, played in the streets. The biggest change for the working class(for which he Thanks God) improvemnt in Famly living conditions.
